greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,k) read by rows: T(n,k) = A005867(k-1)*A002110(n)/A002110(k).
comment: T(n,k) is the triangle in A174909 with reversed row order. (See that sequence for additional comments).

T(n,k) = number of terms with smallest prime factor prime(k) contained in primorial(n) consecutive numbers, k <= n. For example, T(5,4) = 88, so there are 88 terms with smallest prime factor 7 in any sequence of 2310 consecutive numbers.
mathematica: Table[#1 Product[EulerPhi@ Prime@ i, {i, k - 1}]/#2 & @@ Map[Product[ Prime@ i, {i, #}] &, {n, k}], {n, 8}, {k, n}] // Flatten (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Oct 12 2017 *)
xref: Cf. A000040 (prime numbers), A002110, A005867, A053144, A174909 (this triangle with reversed row order).
results.author: _Bob Selcoe_, Oct 11 2017
